reference.title: Memory-mapped PMU registers
reference.shortdesc: This chapter describes the memory-mapped PMU registers and shows examples of how to use them.

link.desc: There are PMU registers that are accessible through the external debug interface.
The PMCFGR contains PMU specific configuration data.

link.linktext: PMCIDR0, Performance Monitors Component Identification Register 0
link.desc: The PMCIDR0 provides information to identify a Performance Monitor component.

link.linktext: PMCIDR1, Performance Monitors Component Identification Register 1
link.desc: The PMCIDR1 provides information to identify a Performance Monitor component.

link.linktext: PMCIDR2, Performance Monitors Component Identification Register 2
link.desc: The PMCIDR2 provides information to identify a Performance Monitor component.

link.linktext: PMCIDR3, Performance Monitors Component Identification Register 3
link.desc: The PMCIDR3 provides information to identify a Performance Monitor component.

link.linktext: PMPIDR0, Performance Monitors Peripheral Identification Register 0
link.desc: The PMPIDR0 provides information to identify a Performance Monitor component.

link.linktext: PMPIDR1, Performance Monitors Peripheral Identification Register 1
link.desc: The PMPIDR1 provides information to identify a Performance Monitor component.

link.linktext: PMPIDR2, Performance Monitors Peripheral Identification Register 2
link.desc: The PMPIDR2 provides information to identify a Performance Monitor component.

link.linktext: PMPIDR3, Performance Monitors Peripheral Identification Register 3
link.desc: The PMPIDR3 provides information to identify a Performance Monitor component.

link.linktext: PMPIDR4, Performance Monitors Peripheral Identification Register 4
link.desc: The PMPIDR4 provides information to identify a Performance Monitor component.

link.linktext: PMPIDRn, Performance Monitors Peripheral Identification Register 5-7
link.desc: No information is held in the Peripheral ID5, Peripheral ID6, and Peripheral ID7 Registers.
